para.text: An unincorporated nonprofit association may acquire, hold, encumber, or transfer in its name an interest in property.
An unincorporated nonprofit association may be a beneficiary of a trust or contract, a legatee, or a devisee.

annotations.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 6 of the Uniform Unincorporated Nonprofit Association Act (2008 Act).
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
annotations.annotation: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 deleted “real or personal” preceding “property” in (a).
